The 2022-23 average class sizes for Districts 3 and 5 fall under the proposed class size caps.

The new class size bill proposes caps of 20 students in kindergarten through third grade, 23 students in fourth through eighth grade, and 25 students in high school. In each of these categories, 2022-23 average class sizes in Districts 3 and 5 fell under the proposed class size caps.

Kindergarten through third grade

Proposed class size cap: 20 students

District 3 average class size: 19.83 students

District 5 average class size: 16.88 students

1 square = 1 student

Fourth through eighth grade

Proposed class size cap: 23 students

District 3 average class size: 20.20 students

District 5 average class size: 18.47 students

Ninth through twelfth grade

Proposed class size cap: 25 students

District 3 average class size: 21.37 students

District 5 average class size: 21.01 students

Note: Average class sizes for kindergarten through eighth grade were calculated using average class sizes of each grade at each school. Average class sizes for high school were calculated using average class sizes of each core class at each school. Only general education programs were included in calculations.

Source: New York City Department of Education

Graphic by Laya Gollamudi
